help.title: In-battle Buff
help.0: Configure the effects of buffs during battle.
help.1: Please enter effects from Agent skills or Core Skills, Engine effects, 4-set Disk effects, and additional abilities here.
help.2: Currently, Attribute DMG buffs are calculated together with DMG%. Please add any Attribute DMG buffs to DMG% as well.
help.3: The information entered here is not directly reflected in the status panel; instead, it is applied to the base damage value.

help.1: The level-based Agent status and Core Skill stat bonus are automatically reflected in the status.
help.2: The Agent’s status is based on values before the level limit break.
help.3: Core Skill effects are not reflected here. Please apply them manually as in-battle buffs.

help1.title: Base Damage
help1.0: Displays the final value used in the damage calculation formula.
help1.1: If you want to enable the Stun bonus, please check 'Trigger Stun State' in the enemy status settings.
help1.2: Damage is calculated using the following formula:
help1.3: Damage = Attack * Crit Multiplier * DMG Multiplier * Skill DMG Multiplier * DEF Multiplier * Break Debuff Ratio * Attribute Multiplier
help1.5: Attribute Multiplier = 100 + Attribute RES Adjustment + Attribute RES Down
help1.6: For Weakness, the Attribute RES Adjustment is +20%. For RES, it is −20%.

help2.0: Based on the Base Damage, the expected damage is calculated.
help2.1: Since the damage is based on presumed specifications and may involve rounding errors, it can differ from the actual in-game damage.
help2.2: From our tests, the margin of error is within ±5%. If you find any major discrepancies, please let us know.
help2.3: Expected damage is calculated using the Crit Multiplier.
help2.4: The values shown at the bottom are the actual Normal DMG and Crit DMG respectively.

help1.title: Disk (Partition)
help1.0: Configure each partition of the Disk.
help1.1: Disk stats according to rank are automatically reflected in the status.
help1.2: The level refers to the stats at max level.
help1.3: If you want to activate a 4-set effect, please equip x2 twice.
help1.4: The following effects are not activated automatically, so please apply them manually:
help1.4.1: The “Tenrai” effect of Astral Voice in its 4-set effect

help2.title: Disk (Set Effect)
help2.0: Configure the Disk set effects here.
help2.1: Set effects are automatically reflected in the status.
help2.2: 4-set effects are automatically reflected as in-battle buffs.

help3.title: Disk (Number of Sub-Stat Upgrades)
help3.0: You can specify how many times the sub-stats on the Disk have been increased.
help3.1: The increase is automatically reflected in the status.

help.title: Engine
help.1: Engine stats and advanced stats based on its level are automatically reflected in the status.
help.2.1: The advanced stats bonus is the stat before the limit break.
help.2.2: Due to insufficient data, some stats for A-rank and B-rank Engines below level 50 may not be accurate.
help.3: The Engine’s effects are not reflected. Please apply them manually in the in-battle buffs.

help.title: Enemy Settings
help.0: You can configure the enemy’s status here.
help.1: Defense factor, attribute factor, and stun bonus are automatically reflected in the base damage value.
help.2: Configure Attribute RES Down caused by Lycaon and DEF Down caused by Nicole here.
help.3: For Rina’s PEN Ratio debuff and similar effects, please manually reflect them in the in-battle buffs.
help.4.1: Base Defense represents the enemy’s defense at level 1. The enemy’s defense is automatically calculated based on this value.
help.4.2: As of Ver1.1, there are discussions that bosses might uniformly have a Base Defense of 60, but since this may change depending on game settings, consider it just a reference. If you are unsure, setting it to 60 is a good choice.
help.5: The defense factor is calculated using the following formula:
help.6: Defense Factor = Agent Level Factor / (Agent Level Factor + Effective Defense)
help.7: Effective Defense = [Defense * (1 - DEF Down) * (1 - PEN Ratio)] - PEN
help.8: Defense = Enemy Level Factor * Base Defense / 50

help.title: Status
help.0: Displays the final status of the Agent.
help.1: The status changes based on the Agent, Engine, and Disk settings.
help.2.1: It is the same as what is shown on the status screen in the formation screen.
help.2.2: However, attribute damage buffs are calculated together with DMG% buffs.
help.3: In-battle buffs are not directly reflected in the status, but are applied to the base damage value.

SaveButton.title: Save Data
SaveButton.description: Please enter the name of the data you want to save.

help1.title: Save Data (Beta)
help1.0: The Beta version now supports saving and loading data.
help1.1: Data is currently stored per browser.
help1.2: You can save or load data using the Save/Load buttons.
help1.3: Note: Overwriting saved data is not currently supported.

About.title: About This Tool
About.1: This site is an unofficial damage calculator for “Zenless Zone Zero.”
About.2: Damage calculations are based on presumed specifications as of Version 1.1 and may include numerical errors.
About.3: Therefore, please note that the values in this data are not guaranteed.
About.4: Also, this site takes no responsibility for any damages incurred by using this data.
About.6: Images used on this site include those quoted from HoYoLAB.
About.7: All rights to these images and to “Zenless Zone Zero” belong to HoYoverse.
About.8: In addition, this site is unofficial and is not affiliated with HoYoverse in any way.
About.10: If you have any feedback, requests, or bug reports, please use
About.12: Google Form or reach out on HoYoLAB.
About.14: If you would like to contribute to the development, please access

2025/01/14.0: You can now select Agents by using images.
2025/01/14.1: The layout has been changed to fix an issue where the display might not work properly on certain screen sizes.

2025/01/11.0: English support has been added as part of multilingual support.
2025/01/11.1: The translation is provided by AI, so it may not be completely accurate.
2025/01/11.2: If you find any mistakes, please let us know.
